reviews.title: Amazing location and wonderful service
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights, and I was very impressed with the overall experience.

reviews.title: Centrally located Tenjin hotel and excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (a) Within a 3 minute walk, you can get to McDonalds, 7-11, Starbucks, tons of really good restaurants
reviews.title: Great value for money, convenient! good service

reviews.text: (b) Within a 5-10 minute walk, you can get to all the large department stores, lots of additional restaurants, supermarkets in Tenjin, as well as the shopping street that houses Zara, Abercrombie and Fitch, H and M, LV, Prada. Seriously, if you are just 5-10 minutes walk away from LV, it screams "best location"
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a very nice city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are small but spotless. Location is prime and staff is as helpful as can be. Great business hotel with laundry room which results very convenient for longer trips.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: I must insist on how nice and helpful is the staff. I've stayed at several Richmonds and will stay again. Also, you get a discount if you register for free as a member of the Richmond Club.
reviews.title: A bit picky with the check-in time...

reviews.text: As others have noted, after an overnight flight Sydney-Narita-Fukuoka and the subway ride from the airport, it is mildly irritating to have to wait two hours for a 2pm check-in time. It is difficult to believe that all appropriate rooms are unavailable at 12 but available at 14 01! That said the room (non-smoking, corner room on upper floor) was very good for the price, booked through Zuji-Singapore. Relatively spacious by Japanese hotel standards, although it helps to be by yourself. The location is convenient to the Tenjin sub-nade, but a bit of a walk (10 min+) if you alight at the subway station, and you definitely need to print off the map from Google maps to show the way underground. The internet was tops: free, fast and reliable. I was also amused at the need for a separate laundry set aside for the exclusive use of female guests, but maybe there are some quirks about male laundry users in Japan which have escaped me!
reviews.title: Can't Believe This Isn't Number 1 in Fukuoka..!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in Oct 2011, and had a great time. We were very pleasantly surprised. Our room was pretty spacious by Japanese standards - the entrance hall and bathroom were split from the bedroom by a sliding door, which made the room seem bigger overall. The fittings were very modern and stylish, and we slept well - no noise from the other rooms around us.
reviews.title: Thanks for everything

reviews.text: The location is very good - right by the metro, and near the main shopping streets in Tenjin. When I read about this in the reviews before visiting Fukuoka, I was a bit worried that the area might be too busy or crowded - but it really isn't. The Richmond Hotel is on a wide street, just on the edge of the busy area, and when you come out you aren't overwhelmed - plenty of space.
reviews.title: Good location and nice & clean hotel

reviews.text: First up the location of this hotel is superb. It is right next to an underground exit so even if it is raining you will not get too wet. It is a stones through from transport and great shopping. The front desk were useful and polite. For the first two nights we stayed in a double room then on the third night switched to a triple. The triple was much bigger, but at almost double the price it should be. The size of the rooms was better than most business hotels. Plan to stay there next time in Fukuoka.
reviews.title: Easy to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night in this hotel, i have to say the location is perfect for nightlife and shopping. Also the room and breakfest for a business hotel was very good. My sister-in-law who lives in Fukuoka organised the hotel for us and she choose well. I would recommend to stay within this area for fir first timers to Fukuoka as evething is located on the door step.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights with my family of 5 people on our first visit to Fukuoka. We took 2 rooms: Hollywood Twin and Twin. The Hollywood Twin was much more spacious, but the Twin room was very comfortable for 2 people with plenty of storage and counter space. Our 2 teenagers loved the free and fast internet (cable connection, not wifi). Although the hotel is on a major and busy street which can be seen from both rooms' windows, we could not hear any street noise at all. We were on the 10th floor.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: As other reviewers have mentioned, this hotel is in a great location right in the middle of the Tenjin area, really convenient for shopping and dining. Mitsukoshi, Daimaru, and Iwataya department stores are all within walking distance. Right next door is Loft, a really interesting lifestyle shop filled with lots of things that you find only in Japan. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant (as there are too many other enticing places outside!) but it seems to be quite a popular place since it's always busy during dinner time.
reviews.title: Just one (major) flaw which mars an otherwise good hotel

reviews.text: Service was excellent, and most if not all of the staff could speak English.
reviews.title: Great Fuss-free Business Hotel

reviews.text: I've gone to this hotel last december with my partner during the New Year's holiday period.
reviews.title: Not so pricey and comfy :)

reviews.text: Location : excellent. It's right in the middle of Tenjin (centre of Fukuoka). It's got a very easy access to the subway station (4 minutes walk from Tenjinminami station) and about 10 minutes walk from the Nishitetsu Omuta line. It's one one of the main streets, so expect quite a lot of traffic.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: Noise : even though it's on one of the main streets, you'll not hear the traffic. The only annoying noise that might wake you up in the middle of the night, is the motorbike noise of bikers rushing through the main street with modified bikes. The clattering sound may make those on the lower floors feel like there is an earthquake... Other than that, it wasn't a problem for us.
reviews.title: Superb Location & Room!!!
